edu.memphis.ccrg.lida.framework
Interface ModuleDriver

All Superinterfaces:
Activatible, java.util.concurrent.Callable<LidaTask>, GuiEventProvider, Initializable, LidaTask, TaskSpawner
All Known Subinterfaces:
GlobalWorkspace
All Known Implementing Classes:
AttentionDriver, EnvironmentImpl, GlobalWorkspaceImpl, ModuleDriverImpl, PamDriver, ProceduralMemoryDriver, SbCodeletDriver, SensoryMemoryDriver, TemDriver, VisionEnvironment, WorkspaceDriver
public interface ModuleDriver
extends Initializable, GuiEventProvider, TaskSpawner

A ModuleDriver is a class that runs a major module of the framework such as PAM or Procedural Memory. The main difference b/w it an a LidaTask is that a LidaTask may not be constantly running while a ModuleDriver is always running.

Author:
Ryan J. McCall
